name: Rogue
description: Rogues rely on skill, stealth, and their foes’ vulnerabilities to get the upper hand in any situation. They have a knack for finding the solution to just about any problem, demonstrating a resourcefulness and versatility that is the cornerstone of any successful adventuring party.

traits.name: Starting Proficiencies
traits.description: As a Rogue, you are proficient with light armor, certain weapons, and thieves' tools. Your saving throw proficiencies are Dexterity and Intelligence. You are also proficient in four skills of your choice.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one skill and thieves’ tools. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.description: Once per turn, you can deal extra damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon. You don't need advantage if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage.

features.name: Thieves’ Cant
features.description: You know thieves’ cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation.

features.name: Cunning Action
features.description: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

features.name: Roguish Archetype
features.description: You choose an archetype that you emulate in the exercise of your rogue abilities. Your choice grants you features at 3rd, 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Uncanny Dodge
features.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack’s damage against you.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: Choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with thieves’ tools). Your proficiency bonus is doubled for these choices.

choiceOptions.label: Choose two more skills/tools for Expertise

features.name: Evasion
features.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

effects.name: Evasion
effects.description: On DEX save for half damage, take no damage on success and half on failure.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Roguish Archetype Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your roguish archetype.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Reliable Talent
features.description: Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

effects.condition: on any ability check that includes your proficiency bonus

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Roguish Archetype Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your roguish archetype.

features.name: Blindsense
features.description: If you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 10 feet of you.

features.name: Slippery Mind
features.description: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Roguish Archetype Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your roguish archetype.

features.name: Elusive
features.description: No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren’t incapacitated.

effects.name: Negate Advantage
effects.condition: on attack rolls against you while not incapacitated

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Stroke of Luck
features.description: If your attack misses a target within range, you can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclasses.name: Arcane Trickster
subclasses.description: Some rogues enhance their fine-honed skills of stealth and agility with magic, learning tricks of enchantment and illusion.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You gain the ability to cast wizard spells, primarily from the enchantment and illusion schools. You learn three cantrips: Mage Hand and two others of your choice from the wizard spell list.

features.name: Mage Hand Legerdemain
features.description: When you cast mage hand, you can make the spectral hand invisible and perform additional tasks with it, such as stowing or retrieving objects, and using thieves' tools at a distance.

features.name: Magical Ambush
features.description: If you are hidden from a creature when you cast a spell on it, the creature has disadvantage on any saving throw it makes against the spell this turn.

features.name: Versatile Trickster
features.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can designate a creature within 5 feet of your spectral mage hand. Doing so gives you advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the end of the turn.

features.name: Spell Thief
features.description: Immediately after a creature casts a spell that targets you or includes you in its area of effect, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a saving throw. On a failed save, you negate the spell’s effect against you and steal the knowledge of the spell for 8 hours. Usable once per long rest.

subclasses.name: Assassin
subclasses.description: You focus your training on the grim art of death. Stealth, poison, and disguise help you eliminate your foes with deadly efficiency.

features.name: Bonus Proficiencies
features.description: You gain proficiency with the disguise kit and the poisoner’s kit.

features.name: Assassinate
features.description: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn in the combat yet. In addition, any hit you score against a creature that is surprised is a critical hit.

effects.condition: against creatures that haven't taken a turn
on hit against a surprised creature

features.name: Infiltration Expertise
features.description: You can unfailingly create false identities for yourself.

features.name: Impostor
features.description: You gain the ability to unerringly mimic another person’s speech, writing, and behavior after studying them for at least three hours.

features.name: Death Strike
features.description: When you attack and hit a creature that is surprised, it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, double the damage of your attack against the creature.

subclasses.name: Inquisitive
subclasses.description: As an Inquisitive, you excel at rooting out secrets and unraveling mysteries. You rely on your keen eye for detail, but also on your finely honed ability to read the words and deeds of other creatures to determine their true intent.

features.name: Ear for Deceit
features.description: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Insight) check to determine if a creature is lying, treat a roll of 7 or lower on the d20 as an 8.

features.name: Eye for Detail
features.description: You can use a bonus action to make a Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a hidden creature or object or an Intelligence (Investigation) check to uncover or decipher clues.

features.name: Insightful Fighting
features.description: As a bonus action, you can make a Wisdom (Insight) check against a creature you can see that isn’t incapacitated, contested by the target’s Charisma (Deception) check. If you succeed, you can use your Sneak Attack against that target even if you don’t have advantage on the attack roll, but not if you have disadvantage on it.

features.name: Steady Eye
features.description: You have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

features.name: Unerring Eye
features.description: As an action, you can sense the presence of illusions, shapechangers not in their original form, and other magic designed to deceive the senses within 30 feet of you, provided you aren’t blinded or deafened.

features.name: Eye for Weakness
features.description: While your Insightful Fighting feature applies to a creature, your Sneak Attack damage against that creature increases by 3d6.

subclasses.name: Mastermind
subclasses.description: Your focus is on people and on the influence and secrets they have. Many spies, courtiers, and schemers follow this archetype, leading lives of intrigue and manipulation.

features.name: Master of Intrigue
features.description: You gain proficiency with the disguise kit, the forgery kit, and one gaming set of your choice. You also learn two languages of your choice.

features.name: Master of Tactics
features.description: You can use the Help action as a bonus action. Additionally, when you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than within 5 feet of you, if the target can see or hear you.

features.name: Insightful Manipulator
features.description: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities.

features.name: Misdirection
features.description: You can sometimes cause another creature to suffer an attack meant for you. When you are targeted by an attack while a creature within 5 feet of you is granting you cover against that attack, you can use your reaction to have the attack target that creature instead of you.

features.name: Soul of Deceit
features.description: Your thoughts can’t be read by telepathy or other means, unless you allow it. You can present false thoughts by making a Charisma (Deception) check. Additionally, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to determine if you are telling the truth.

subclasses.name: Scout
subclasses.description: You are skilled in stealth and surviving far from the streets of a city, allowing you to scout ahead of your companions during expeditions.

features.name: Skirmisher
features.description: You can move up to half your speed as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

features.name: Survivalist
features.description: You gain proficiency in the Nature and Survival skills. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those proficiencies.

features.name: Superior Mobility
features.description: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. If you have a climbing or swimming speed, this increase applies to that speed as well.

features.name: Ambuscade
features.description: You excel at leading ambushes and acting first. You have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, the first creature you hit during the first round of a combat becomes easier for you and others to strike.

features.name: Sudden Strike
features.description: If you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as a bonus action. This attack can benefit from your Sneak Attack even if you have already used it this turn, but you can’t use your Sneak Attack against the same target more than once in a turn.

subclasses.name: Swashbuckler
subclasses.description: You focus your training on the art of the blade, relying on speed, elegance, and charm in equal measure.

features.name: Fancy Footwork
features.description: During your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature can’t make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

features.name: Rakish Audacity
features.description: You can add your Charisma modifier to your initiative rolls. In addition, you don’t need advantage on your attack roll to use your Sneak Attack if no other creatures are within 5 feet of you, you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll, and the target of the attack is within 5 feet of you.

features.name: Panache
features.description: As an action, you can make a Charisma (Persuasion) check contested by a creature's Wisdom (Insight) check. If you succeed, the target is charmed by you for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. In combat, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you.

features.name: Elegant Maneuver
features.description: You can use a bonus action on your turn to gain advantage on the next Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Strength (Athletics) check you make during the same turn.

features.name: Master Duelist
features.description: If you miss with an attack roll, you can roll it again with advantage. Once you do so, you can’t use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclasses.name: Phantom
subclasses.description: Phantoms are rogues who have a mystical connection to death, letting them tap into the power of the deceased.

features.name: Whispers of the Dead
features.description: You can gain one skill or tool proficiency of your choice at the end of a short or long rest. This proficiency lasts until you use this feature again.

features.name: Wails from the Grave
features.description: As a reaction when you deal Sneak Attack damage, you can target a second creature within 30 feet and deal half the number of Sneak Attack dice in psychic damage to it. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

features.name: Tokens of the Departed
features.description: When a life ends in your presence, you can create a soul trinket. You can use this trinket to ask the spirit questions or destroy it to gain advantage on Constitution saving throws or death saving throws.

features.name: Ghost Walk
features.description: As a bonus action, you can assume a spectral form, gaining a flying speed of 10 feet and the ability to move through creatures and objects for 10 minutes.

features.name: Death's Knell
features.description: Your Wails from the Grave now deals full Sneak Attack damage. When you use a soul trinket, you can now deal psychic damage to the target of your Sneak Attack.

subclasses.name: Soulknife
subclasses.description: Most assassins strike with physical weapons, but you strike with the mind. These rogues discover psionic power within themselves and channel it to do their roguish work.

features.name: Psionic Power
features.description: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. This energy is represented by your Psionic Energy dice, which are d6s. You have a number of these dice equal to twice your proficiency bonus, and they fuel various psionic powers you have.

features.name: Psychic Blades
features.description: You can manifest a psychic blade from your free hand and make an attack with it. The blade is a simple melee weapon with the finesse and thrown properties. It deals 1d6 psychic damage. After you attack, you can make a bonus action attack with a second blade that deals 1d4 psychic damage.

features.name: Soul Blades
features.description: Your Psychic Blades now deal 1d8 damage. You can also use your Psionic Energy dice to perform a Homing Strikes (add die to a missed attack roll) or Psychic Teleport (teleport as a bonus action).

features.name: Psychic Veil
features.description: As an action, you can magically become invisible for up to 1 hour or until you deal damage or force a saving throw. Usable once per long rest or by expending 3 Psionic Energy dice.

features.name: Rend Mind
features.description: When you use your Psychic Blades to deal Sneak Attack damage to a creature, you can force that creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is stunned until the start of your next turn.

subclasses.name: Thief
subclasses.description: You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cutpurses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype, but so do rogues who prefer to think of themselves as professional treasure seekers, explorers, and investigators.

features.name: Fast Hands
features.description: You can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your thieves’ tools to disarm a trap or open a lock, or take the Use an Object action.

features.name: Second-Story Work
features.description: Climbing no longer costs you extra movement. In addition, when you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.

features.name: Supreme Sneak
features.description: You have advantage on a Dexterity (Stealth) check if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

effects.condition: if you move no more than half your speed

features.name: Use Magic Device
features.description: You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

features.name: Thief’s Reflexes
features.description: You can take two turns during the first round of any combat. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at your initiative minus 10. You can’t use this feature when you are surprised.
